detailsOfAchievement: Balpanchyat (Child Rights Forum)- Paryay has developed and implemented a unique module of Child Rights Forum. This successful module is used by Government Training Institute as a training module for Government Machinery.  Land Rights - Paryay is successfully working in 300 villages and submitted legal documents to Government for land acquisition. The process is well recognized by the Government and it will soon benefit 6229 Families.  Dalit Women empowerment - Paryay has effectively worked on Panchayt Raj Institute issue and Village Governance. After the intervention a visible effect is observed in 70 villages where Dalit women are now taking lead in Village Governance.  Micro Finance - Paryay has established a community based Micro Finance Institute. Around 500 SHGs are closely evolved in this federation. Mainly women are handling all process and programmes of this federation. Recently Micro-Finance Institute has successfully made Rs. 1 corers turnover.

Currently, our sanstha is working with the nomadic tribes called Nandiwale and Gosavi.We had a series of discussions with this community living in different villages of Tasgaon & Palus block. During the discussions, we come to know that the educational development of these people Kampers . Therefore, we are now planning to implement a comprehensive development programme for such people living in different villages of Tasgaon and Palus block. We are working Against Commercial Sexual Exploitation & Trafflcking in Tasgaon and Palus Talukas in Sangli District. We have made Taluka Committees, District Committees. We have solved out about 21 cases related to women, teenage girls, etc. During the course of our activities related to women development we experienced that there are so many women (Widow, diverse, destitutes) who are neglected vulnerable and deprived of basic services like health and education. Currently, our society is working with the development of the nomadic tribes called Nandiwale and Gosavi. We had a series of discussions with this community living in different villages of Tasgaon & Palus block. During the discussions, we come to know that the educational development of these women Kampers .The women are under tension for their economic and family problems. Therefore, we are now planning to implement a comprehensive development programme for such women living in different villages of Tasgaon and Palus block. title: Prashanti Cancer Care Mission
actName: Act No 21 of year 1860 - Society Registration Act
detailsOfAchievement: Prashanti Cancer Care Mission has created an unique system for interdisciplinary problem solving in various aspects of Breast Cancer (BC) diagnosis, and management. It is actively involved in educating the community about BC and creating awareness, public outreach and early detection of women cancers via community screening, providing patient care through screening, diagnosis, and treatment of BC patients, providing patient aid, affordable cancer management and financial support, offering patient support through counseling & rehabilitation to BC patients & families, improving the quality of life of BC patients and survivors. It has also established Orchids Breast Health Center (OBHC), a Centre of Affordable Excellence in Breast Care, perhaps Indias first dedicated Breast Centre for hi-tech diagnosis and treatment of BC. It has also established Indias first dedicated Breast Oncoplastic Unit and International School of Oncoplastic Surgery involving organisation of an Annual IndoBritish Advanced Master Class in OBS and BC Symposium. It is well known for its pioneering work in breast reconstruction technique, which allows restoration of breast shape and improves quality of life in BC patients. It has also obtained SIRO Status from Government of India in 2015, Membership to National Cancer Grid of India in 2015, thereby, opening the possibilities of national and international collaborations in cancer research which has led to collaborative research projects with prestigious national & international research centers. Capacity building through Oncoplastic Breast Surgery conferences (OBS) and clinical research workshops are also part of the activities at Prashanti Cancer Care Mission.

detailsOfAchievement: Pratham Mumbai Education Initiative started in Mumbai in 1994 with the vision and mission of Every Child in School and Learning Well. In the early years, Prathams area of work was Mumbai now it is spread across India. Pratham Council for Vulnerable Children (PCVC) serves as the Child Rights and Protection wing of Pratham, established in the year 2000, with the aim of Every Childs Rights Protected, Every Child in School and Learning Well. Initially PCVC started as an outreach program in the urban slum communities of Mumbai, responding to the needs of children belonging to underserved communities emphasising on a specific segment of out of school and working children. Today, PCVC has grown from being an organization focused on working with child labourers, to a Rights based and Resource organization, working on protection and safeguarding rights of children. While working in Mumbai, many working children were observed who had migrated from other states, majority of whom were without family. With PCVCs continuous intervention with these children, a pattern of interstate movement was identified, where children leave their home states (source) to find work in metro cities (receiving). As a result of the increasing trend of unsafe migration among children, PCVC expanded its work in other states, at both source and receiving end in order to curb the issue of child labour and unsafe migration. Today, PCVC has strong presence in eleven states of India Gujarat, Rajasthan, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Maharashtra, Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh and Jharkhand. covering around 2,00,000 marginalized children (working children, street children, abused children)annually in urban and rural areas through direct programs such as Child Rights Protection Desks, Focus City and Block Interventions, Child Rights Sessions in Schools, Multiple Activity Centres, Health and Disability initiatives. Given the dynamic nature of the field we are engaged in, PCVC continuously strives to keep its knowledge base updated, advocate for Policy changes and facilitate innovation on field. Recent studies undertaken to achieve this are: Opinion Poll on Child Labour across PCVC states 1,17,711 people reached Nation-wide Study on the Status of Children on Indian Railways  covered 63 stations in 17 states of the country Tracking between Source and Destination Railway Platforms to Identify Unsafe Migration of Children at 15 railway stations across PCVC states reaching out to 7,529 children Study reports on Quality Institutional Care With over a decade of working with children, PCVC has witnessed various milestones through achievements at both field and policy level such as: Initiated the concept of convergence of various concerned Departments through Task Force at the State level to mitigate child labour Established inter-state coordination between source and receiving states for rescue, repatriation and rehabilitation of child labourers Replication of residential model for rehabilitation of rescued child labourers by the state Providing training and orientation on Child Protection to officials of various Government Departments, Police and NGOs Monitoring strict implementation of Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) laid down by the State and Central Government and Child Rights Commission
